p: The causative agent of Covid-19 was tentatively named as 2019 n-CoV (2019 novel coronavirus) by WHO on 12th January 2020 ( Sun et al., 2020). On 11th February 2020, it was officially named as SARS-CoV-2 (severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2) by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses ( Gautret et al., 2020; Rasmussen et al., 2020). It is now understood that SARS-CoV-2 has a 96.2% structural similarity with a bat coronavirus (CoV RaTG13) and 79.5% similarity with SARS-CoV. However, its spike (S) glycoprotein has a 10â€“20 times higher affinity to human ACE2 receptors as compared to SARS-CoV, leading to more chances of human-to-human transmission; though having a lesser mortality rate (average 3.4%) than that of SARS (9.6%) and MERS (35%) respectively ( Guo et al., 2020).
